description:
Learn how to craft a simple miniature castle gatehouse for tabletop games such as D&D or Warhammer. I have crafted more castle related terrain that you can find on the channel, check it out for more cheap tabletop terrain and miniatures for D&D.
↓↓ Check out the Super Interesting Links↓↓

➢Support the Channel on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/bardscraft 
➢or donate Paint Funds: https://www.paypal.me/lsjoman
➢Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/bardscraft/
Thank you, any support is significant, as it allows me to craft more Terrain & Minis, and make simple tutorials of the process.

      -------------------------------------------------------------------------------

PLAYLISTS TO WATCH
➢All my Monster Miniatures: https://tinyurl.com/y22ck2cv 
➢All my Terrain for D&D: https://tinyurl.com/yyco9kkr 
➢Dragons!: https://tinyurl.com/yyeq7qed
➢Simple Castle Terrain: https://tinyurl.com/y4x34ldc
➢Crafting Guides & Experiments: https://tinyurl.com/y6zxxc2f

          -------------------------------------------------------------------------------

ESSENTIAL ITEMS (any purchases following these link support the channel, thanks!)
➢5th Edition Monster Manual: https://amzn.to/2p5WHOn
➢7$ Kitchen "Crafting" Knife: https://amzn.to/2pK2A3T
➢PVA-Glue: https://amzn.to/2Wcesrp
➢Sturdy Utility Knife + Blades: https://amzn.to/2oceKCb
➢Handheld Foam Cutter: https://amzn.to/2WhDHbO
Disclaimer: I have not used the specific products, but I checked them and simply assume that they will do. I Hope this helps you get started!

          -------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Join the Bard's Craft Discord server where we shall share and discuss Tabletop Crafting!
➢Bard's Craft Nerd Chat: https://discord.gg/n5AfW36

GUIDELINES
0:09 CUTTING THE WALLS - If you can find foam that is already of suitable thickness, good for you.

0:29 TEXTURING WITH ALUMINIUM FOIL - Don't be afraid to really add some pressure to get deeper dents in some areas.

0:53 CARVING THE STONE TEXTURE - You can skip this part if you wish, not all stonework is visible on medieval castles. The stonework would usually be covered in some kind of white-ish clay mixture. So you could paint the walls much less dark with a heavier white drybrush.

1:42 BATTLEMENT BRICKS - It is easier to add texture (with aluminum foil ball) before you glue the bricks. You can also skip the "cut the smaller bricks thinner" part if you don't care about the Machicolations.

2:06 GLUEING BRICKS - If you skip the machicolations, it will be much easier to glue the bricks onto the gatehouse.

2:31 PAINTING - Paint Black → Grey → Light Grey → Off-white. To create a more natural look, you can add hints of brown, green and red to the paints.

3:23 PLATFORM, DOOR, LADDER & PORTCULLIS GATE - Check out my quick tutorial for Wooden Stuff: https://youtu.be/437p1gwNNuE 
 I just added some black to the silver paint I had laying around to create something that resembles iron.

4:10 ASSEMBLY & SHOWCASE - All parts are easily removed and put back into place to enhance gameplay. The machicolations really do add to the playability and look to any d&d castle encounters.
If you have any similar ideas, past or future projects, please share! Miniature castles are awesome!
